security_audit.summary: This is a documentation-only template skill containing no executable code. SKILL.md is a markdown file that describes skill structure and patterns. The static analysis scanner generated false positives by misinterpreting documentation references (script paths, URLs) as executable patterns. No actual code execution, network requests, or cryptographic operations exist in this skill.

content.value_statement: Users need reusable skills that activate automatically based on context. This template provides a starting point for building skills that perform specific tasks without manual invocation.
actual_capabilities: Auto-invokes based on context and file patterns
References local scripts for extended functionality
Uses templates from skill assets directory
limitations: Template only - requires customization for actual use
No predefined task logic - must be implemented
Scripts and assets directories may be empty
User must define specific trigger conditions

use_cases.title: Build new skills quickly
use_cases.description: Use this template as a starting point for creating new Claude Code skills with proper structure.

use_cases.title: Standardize skill format
use_cases.description: Ensure all skills in a plugin follow consistent patterns using this template.

use_cases.title: Document skill capabilities
use_cases.description: Provide clear documentation for skill users with examples and usage patterns.

prompt_templates.title: Create skill structure
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a new skill called [skill-name] using the example-skill template. The skill should [describe what it does] and activate when [describe trigger conditions].

prompt_templates.title: Add capability
prompt_templates.prompt: Add a new capability to [existing-skill] that [describes new functionality]. Reference best practices from the skill documentation.

prompt_templates.title: Write documentation
prompt_templates.prompt: Write clear documentation for [skill-name] including when it auto-invokes, what capabilities it provides, and how users should interact with it.

prompt_templates.title: Configure triggers
prompt_templates.prompt: Define the exact conditions under which [skill-name] should auto-invoke, including file patterns, user queries, and detected situations.

output_examples.input: Create a skill that helps with API documentation
output: Trigger: When user opens or modifies files with .api, .openapi, or .swagger extension

output_examples.input: Build a skill that validates configuration files
output: Trigger: When user opens or modifies .json, .yaml, or .yml files

best_practices: Define clear trigger conditions so Claude knows when to auto-invoke the skill
Keep capability descriptions specific and actionable, not generic
Place actual scripts, references, and assets in their respective subdirectories
anti_patterns: Leaving placeholder text like 'task X' or 'situation W' in published skills
Declaring tools in allowed-tools without using them in the skill logic
Creating skills that activate on too many conditions, causing context flooding

faq.question: How is this different from an agent?
faq.answer: Skills auto-invoke based on context while agents require manual invocation via the Task tool. Skills provide always-on expertise.

faq.question: What tools can skills use?
faq.answer: Skills can use Read, Grep, Glob, Bash, Edit, Write, and other Claude Code tools based on allowed-tools configuration.

faq.question: Can skills execute scripts?
faq.answer: Yes, skills can reference and execute scripts in their scripts/ directory using Bash tool commands.

faq.question: How do skills access their resources?
faq.answer: Skills use the {baseDir} variable to reference files in their directory, such as {baseDir}/scripts/ or {baseDir}/references/

faq.question: Are skills safe to install?
faq.answer: Skills only access files within their directory unless granted additional permissions. Review the SKILL.md for allowed tools.

faq.question: Can I modify an installed skill?
faq.answer: Skills are typically in read-only directories. Copy the skill to your project and customize it locally if needed.
